placeMetadata.description: Popular locale for watching the sunset featuring a rocky shoreline with park benches above.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The Hidden Twin beach, situated near the Bhagavathy Amman Temple and close to Kanyakumari bus station, is a popular destination for watching sunsets. This picturesque locale boasts a rocky shoreline adorned with park benches above. It attracts visitors who come to admire its natural landscape while visiting the Vivekanand Rock memorial. Unlike many other beaches in India, it offers facilities for sitting and enjoying the serene beauty of nature.
placeMetadata.address: Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu, India

reviews.reviewText: where the sea and sky meet. A poetic experience

The Hidden Twin Beach in Kanyakumari, India, is a serene and picturesque destination that offers a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. With its pristine golden sands, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and lush greenery, this beach is a perfect paradise for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation ¹.

*Key Highlights:*

- _Unspoiled Natural Beauty_: The beach boasts pristine golden sands and crystal-clear turquoise waters, making it an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, and snorkeling ¹.
- _Peaceful Atmosphere_: The Hidden Twin Beach provides a peaceful escape from the crowds, making it perfect for families with children or those seeking a relaxing day by the sea ¹.
- _Thriving Marine Life_: The beach is known for its vibrant underwater world, filled with colorful coral reefs and exotic fish species, making it a paradise for snorkelers and divers ¹.

*Amenities and Activities:*

- _Clean Restroom Facilities_: The beach has well-maintained restroom facilities, making it a convenient spot for visitors ¹.
- _Designated Picnic Areas_: There are several shaded spots with benches, perfect for a picnic with friends or family ¹.
- _Lifeguards_: The presence of lifeguards ensures the safety of visitors, further enhancing the overall experience ¹.

Overall, The Hidden Twin Beach is a must-visit destination for those seeking a relaxing and peaceful beach experience in India.
Serene beauty. Not crowded. Best place to relax with an evening tea...

The best place for a getaway.
I visited Hidden Twin Beach on September 2016.
Nearly 3 years back, when this place was actually Hidden from the Mainland.
At that time, I slept overnight in this beautiful beach and I really know how it feels to be part of Nature.
The Twin Beach is real, 0 pollution and No crowd at all.
I really loved the vibe out there in the Hidden Twin Beach.
Now it’s common to every travellers.
It was unique at the time I was travelling.
To unravel the beach itself was an adventure.
We have to walk miles from the mainstream to reach here.
We get a joy of Discovery at those time.
Now it’s outdated I guess.
Anyways.. Hidden Twin Beach was LIT 🔥
Beautiful clean beach . With amazing sunset point
Thou have gone many times, these people charge 20 or something for entry. as if that sea belongs to them. Not sure if it exists. Have already complained to municipality no resolution taken.
I enjoyed it a lot with swimming in this place along with my brothers we spent 40 min here
Great place.

In addition to being a private waterfront property, this luxurious kanyakumari Beach Resorts is perfect for a few days of escape from the stress of city life. This is a basic poor people paradise kinda hotels don't book this if you want all the amenities of a room to sleep with less money you can go here it does not have an ac or fan in temp of 44°c so you calculate the level of luxury :)

The hotel provides 24-hour security, daily housekeeping, and various facilities to ensure a comfortable stay. reviews.reviewText:
I recently visited Kanyakumari with my daughter and parents and stayed at Sea View Hotel. It was a wonderful experience! The hotel is conveniently located near Parvati Mata Temple and Vivekananda Rock Memorial, both within walking distance.
We booked a sea-facing room, which offered a breathtaking view, especially in the morning. The hotel staff was exceptional, always courteous and ready to assist. A special mention to Mani Sir, who was always happy to help, along with the rest of the team.
For food, we initially tried Saravana, but it didn’t meet our expectations. Eventually, we ended up having all our meals at Sea View Hotel, where the food was delicious, and the service was excellent. I highly recommend both the stay and dining experience at Sea View Hotel for anyone visiting Kanyakumari.

Awesome Experience. 5/5 in all categories. Best Sunrise view from hotel room, Best view of statue of wisdom and swami Vivekanand memorial. Near to temple and market, best in room dining experience, Very good breakfast with lots of option, very polite staffs and no language problem. Overall it was a pleasant stay and thank you!! Value for money.

Fantastic hotel location wise, adequate parking, good rooms especially the sea view ones. Room service is excellent. Food is good. Nice bar in the basement. Plan breakfast is very wide spread with an array of dishes from continental to South Indian, north indian, eggs, cut fruits..... excellent. Must stay hotel. I love this place. The only negative point is the saggy beds which don't provide comfortable sleep.

To the wonderful team at Hotel Sea View, our stay was absolutely fantastic. From the moment we arrived, your hospitality felt thoughtful and welcoming The hotel staff was very courteous,
The room service was consistently quick and courteous. The room itself was cozy, clean, and well-appointed. Thank you for making our trip so memorable—we can’t wait to come back.We left with big smiles and fond memories. Highly recommend!
Regards lovebto come back soon
Milan Shah & Family Cochin

Hotel is so good and sea view is very good. The food provided in the breakfast is toooo good and the facility in the hotel is comparable to 4 star hotel. The hotel bearers are very polite and reachable for all queries.
Money is worth to stay better to book always before reaching

Location is a super advantage.  Property is located at a stone's throw from Thiruvalluvar Statue, Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Glass Bridge. I understand it is recently renovated while maintaining old charm. Complimentary breakfast spread is too good. Many rooms have sea view also.
Definitely recommend this for Kanyakumari stay. Worth it!!

Clean and well lit rooms, well mannered staff. Particularly receptionist Mrs. Anitha was very warm and welcoming.
Totally recommend Hotel Sea View for Kanyakumari Stay with family. Complimentary breakfast was good with varied options.

I visited here with my kids and in laws.The rooms were really nice,clean with a great view.All the rooms have good view and easily accessible to the marketplace.Their in house restaurant is really good.We loved the food during our last visit in April and hence decided to stay here this time.
overall I would give 10 on 10 for all the categories.

reviews.reviewText:
The rooms were not at all clean, we had missing towels, dirty sheets, and the odor when you go into the room the first day is really unpleasant.

Hotel staff would not try to help out with what our concerns were when we asked and were somewhat rude by saying that they will provide what we asked for yet during the entire stay we didn’t receive anything we asked for from the start.

The location on the other hand is somewhat decent, the sunrise point is roughly a 5 minute walk and the sunset point is a 8 minute drive, all respectable amounts of distance.

Overall, the hotel all in all was not clean, not the best and would not recommend a stay at this hotel. The rooms and service were not up to my personal par, and the only thing I enjoyed this trip was the sunrise and sunset.

Our experience at this hotel was terrible from start to finish. The room was dirty, with stained sheets and a musty smell. The staff were unhelpful and dismissive whenever we raised concerns. The corridors reeked of a rotten food smell, making it unpleasant to even walk to our room. The overall upkeep of the property was poor, and it felt neglected and unwelcoming. For the price we paid, we expected at least a clean and comfortable stay, but this was far from it. Definitely not worth the money

My experience with this hotel was okay. But the hotel's cleanliness must be improved. Dust everywhere, flies everywhere. The hotel outside looks grand like the name. But the rooms still look like 80s or 90s look. Dear owner of the hotel please look up this matter.

Staff : No problem, all are friendly and helpful.

Restaurant: Foods are nice. But flies everywhere, after seeing the flies, I don't have any idea to eat. Cleanliness is so important.

Housekeeping : Make a bed all are perfect. But dust everywhere.

Thank you

Horrible Experience – Avoid This Hotel at All Costs!

I had one of the worst hotel experiences ever at this property. The room we were given was in terrible condition — the bathroom was filthy and clearly hadn't been cleaned properly. The bed linen was torn, worn out, and looked extremely unhygienic.

Even worse, we saw rats running around in the corridor, which is completely unacceptable for any hospitality establishment. When I approached the front desk and asked to change rooms, the receptionist Pandian was extremely rude, dismissive, and unprofessional. He refused to even listen to our concerns. His behavior alone was enough to ruin the stay.

The food served was below average and nowhere near the quality advertised. To top it all off, my father's earphones, which were accidentally left in the room, were stolen.

The entire experience was traumatizing, and I would strongly warn others to stay away. The positive reviews you see online are misleading or possibly fake — the hotel is nothing like the pictures shown on booking platforms.

Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else.

Location was great. We could just walk to the ferry counter, main temple and view points. Location is perfect and if that is your priority, this hotel is good. However rooms need improvement. Lamp lights were broken. Towels given to us were a bit torn. Curtain rod also broken. Needs improvement.
Staff was good and courteous. They were agile and polite. I think that is their biggest strength.
Breakfast in the hotel was okay. Rush needs to be managed better.

Do NOT book this hotel!
Absolutely worst experience. This hotel cheats customers and is completely unprofessional. I booked a room via Agoda and asked the receptionist about early check-in or if any room was available. He refused and when I politely asked if I cancel, would I get my refund, he said “Yes, you can cancel from Agoda, and we will process your refund.” I confirmed this twice and then cancelled the booking. Later, they denied my refund and behaved very inappropriately.
Totally dishonest and untrustworthy. Avoid at all costs!

We had checked in this evening at 7pm and the room was terrible. No Heigine, cobwebs hanging in the room, washroom not clean, dirt fan also it's broken fan, shakes a lot when switched on. Overall terrible experience, because of which we had to checkout out immediately.

Please be awear of things before booking there is no hot water facilities in all rooms .. We where asked to take shower in the next vacant room which was quite discomfort.
Bathroom was not so clean . From outside it looks good but rooms are renowned but bathroom door mirror was like very gold even bathroom was not clean. Bread fast was good

reviews.reviewText: Annai celestial resort is in a very compact and ideal location. It is just 500 meters from the famous Bagavathi temple and Boat jetty. The sunrise and sunset points are nearby only. You will have a fantastic view from all the rooms.
Renovations were going on. Great rooms. Good food but expensive. Right on the beach.

Great location in town to get to all the sights. 20/25 minute walk to the ferry to get a trip out to the island, about the same distance the other way to get to sunset point. The staff at the hotel we're very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our stay there. Our room was quite good, a little old but clean. The aircon sort of worked but we needed the fan on as well to keep the room at a sensible temperature. We ate at the hotel and really enjoyed the food plus the friendly service. We didn't use the pool but it looked very good. Overall, a good stay in a good location
They didnot provide drivers accomadation heavy charge rooms

The hotel is slightly old and the rooms definitely need a renovation. The service was not that great. I was asked for checkout time even before I could check in. They kept insisting on 10AM as the checkout time even though I told them I have to leave early in the morning itself. Not sure why this push. At the breakfast and dinner which I had from their restaurant the staff weren't very interested in helping you. 3-4 of them stood in a corner and were chatting. I would recommend to step out and have your meals if you have the transport options because the price is not worth it at all.

Overall the location is great and rooms are decent but service is bad.

Value for money. Check in and check out processes were smooth. Staffs were courteous

Deluxe room - Spacious yet needs to be renovated. Bed lamps are not safe it was earthening a bit. Air conditioning unit was old one and doesn't fit for the room size, took a lot of time to settle in.

Ambience - Pool and garden area neatly maintained. Restaurant service was decent, could've more options in buffet

Location - Excellent 👌👌 just opposite of sea view

Stayed here for official visit. Unique ambience (little old style but maintained). Clean and spacious rooms. Books available for reading (haven't seen this in any other hotel). Garden is beautiful (you can see peacocks roaming around you). Sea facing entrance. You can go for morning/evening walk and enjoy sunrise as well as sunset from the view tower which is hardly 5 min walk from this hotel. Can work on pest control chemicals smell.

The place has a beach frontage and looks like an old property --rooms are neat and spacious --but we can get only a glimpse of  the sea and that too from a few rooms. Hence the charm in checking into the hotel which is quite pricey , is lost. We had to literally beg for a room with a sea view to which they finally obliged. Moreover this cannot be called a resort since the property is not very big except for the landscaped garden in front .And the amenities available in a resort are lacking in the rooms and especially the bathrooms which are quite small and moderate unlike the ones seen in good resorts. They have to definitely improve on it to rise to the level of a resort.
The redeeming factor is the proximity to the sea and sun rise and sun set view points which is just a walking distance away. Good for a one day stay

reviews.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay at Tri Sea Hotel! The staff was exceptionally warm and welcoming, always ready to assist with a smile. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, offering a relaxing atmosphere throughout my stay. I especially appreciated the beautiful view from the rooftop and the excellent room service. Overall, it was a great experience, and I would highly recommend Tri Sea Hotel to anyone visiting the area. Keep up the great work!

The location of the hotel is good. However the rooms are not very clean. The sheets had stains. The blankets do not come with covers. The fan made a squeaky sound and the AC remote was not functioning. No toiletries were provided other than hand soap.

Hot water does not come to the shower. It can be used only with the mug and bucket system.

Additionally they seem to have a minimum occupancy rule. Solo travelers are not welcome.

Overall I recommend choosing a different hotel as there are plenty in the area.

The hotel is at good location...sun rise and sun set can be viewed from terrace. But rooms are little bit cozzy...which is not my preference. Service of hotel was very good. Good for one night to enjoy beach view. All rooms door are open to 360 degree view of Ocean

I recently stayed at this hotel, and it exceeded all my expectations. The highlight was definitely the room with a breathtaking view of the sea.

The room was clean, spacious, and tastefully decorated that made it easy to enjoy the view at any time. The bed was very comfortable, and all the amenities were top-notch.

The staff was friendly and always ready to help with anything we needed. Housekeeping was thorough and prompt, and the overall service made our stay even more pleasant.

The location is perfect – just steps from the beach and within walking distance of restaurants and shops. It’s ideal for a relaxing vacation.

I highly recommend booking a sea-facing room here – it adds a whole new level of charm to the experience. Can’t wait to return!

We stay here for 1 night and stay was very comfortable. Service was good.
Sun rise view is amazing.
Please do visit this hotel in very affordable rate.

Best experience we had in a resort with low cost. Located in kanyakumari, we see " sun raise "  ,"  sun set " and We can see Arabian sea, Hindu ocean , Bay of bengal sea directly from hotel top with a beautiful view,  You have play area for children and swimming pool too. Spacious and clean rooms. Very well maintained. Staff is polite and helpful.and also it is very reasonable price and we can enjoy

We stayed 5 people in a family room, with 1 bathroom + 1 washroom. It was comfortable and clean. Good view from the room balcony and lift as we. Very near and walkable to sunrise point, Kanyakumari temple, ferry to Swami Vivekananda Rock. Recommend to family, friends and ppl travelling to Kanyakumari

Do not blindly go with the ratings. The customers review and give rating because they ask for Good rating. The location is good. But room is not clean, old blankets and no space in the room to walk. Was disappointed to go this place just by reviews.

reviews.reviewText: Nothing is better then staying here in hotel sea face at kanyakumari. Excellent rooms, polite staff and good hospitality. Every attraction is on walking distance from here. Great view from my room . Overall a memorable stay here.

I stayed during the first week of July 2025. The rooms were quite clean, the staff was courteous, and the property has been newly renovated. I would definitely recommend it, especially for its direct view of the Swami Vivekananda Memorial and the beautiful sea.

The hotel is located in a very nice place.
We can see Triveni Sangam from the room and an amazing view of the sunrise. The rooms are very spacious, clean and well maintained. The staff are very kind and helpful. The temple is very close to the hotel giving an advantage for tourists. The hotel is also close to the rock memorial, ferry service, gandhi Mandapam, beach road, view points and the local shopping places. The breakfast spread was very good with a large variety of options. The hotel also offered ample parking space. I would highly recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in Kanyakumari

My stay at sea face hotel in kanniyakumari was absolutely fantastic from start to finish. The **service was impeccable**—the staff went above and beyond to ensure a comfortable and memorable experience. From the warm welcome at check-in to the attentive housekeeping, every detail was handled with care.

The room was **spacious, modern, and spotlessly clean**, with a super comfortable bed and high-quality linens. The bathroom was well-stocked with premium toiletries, and housekeeping did an excellent job maintaining cleanliness daily.

A great place to stay in Kanyakumari. Bang on the seashore with easy access to prominent spots. Sea face rooms offer great views of sunrise and vivekananda rock. Clean rooms, great service and friendly staff.We had a great time during the entire stay.
The hotel offers an exceptionally large buffet breakfast stunning view from the room, and beautiful sights of Vivekananda memorial, Valluvar statue and the glass bridge, all near kanyakumari temple.

Had a lovely experience! The service was excellent and always on time. The pricing was reasonable, and the views were simply awesome. The room service was top notch, everything was neat, clean, and well maintained. Highly recommended!
The hotel’s large breakfast spread, sunrise from the room, and scenic views of Vivekananda Memorial, Valluvar Statue, and the glass bridge made for a memorable stay.

reviews.reviewText:
Clean, arranged, safe.. pleased to stay there..
AC works fine, Geaser not available.
Receptionists are very helpful.
Location: near to sunset and sunrise view point..

Out of the main town, you won't get auto from the front of the hotel, but the manager will promptly arrange.
Location is good for those who love nature and calmness, the roof has amazing view, you will hear birds chirping throughout the day. Beautiful sunset point is 10 minutes walk.
During our stay cook was absent so we had free access to the kitchen, the very young manager was so helpful we made our own food, swiggy delivery is available though.
Rooms were spacious, with ample luggage space, bed was clean, toilet big and clean..
Overall good experience

Located very near to sunset point. Located bit interior but in a very calm and peaceful location. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Pets are allowed to stay in this hotel. The stay was more like staying in a private beach house. Good recommended for people who needs privacy and out from crowded hotels.

I want to give negative rating. I reached on 21st feb , morning around 4:30, was with my family. Travelled more than 3000km from Guwahati. No one was there, doors locked. We waited there. Called reception through oyo app, rung bell 20-25 times nobody showed up. At that point of time we had nowhere to go, the place is very remote, far from proper sights. Never book this hotel. And please never book through oyo. Ask the local people ,they will show you hotels 2star , 3star ,4star whichever is convenient for you, you can book that hotel.

This was one one of the most unpleasant stay in my trip to South India.

Pros:
Giving 2 stars for room and wi-fi.

Cons:
- Paid extra for meal with hotel rent which we didn't got.
- Charged us ₹850 for the lunch which was uncooked jeera rice and uncooked fish without salt. Had to go outside for the decent food.
- Caretaker was drunk most of the time so couldn't argue with him.
- No one was at reception in day 1. Seemed like a haunted place.
- Got us an auto and charged ₹120 for 1.9 km travel. Actual amount while coming back from auto was ₹50.
- Worst was the food that was served. Felt embarrassed to bring my parents here.

The Resort is situated exactly 1.5 km from Kanyakumari Bagathi amman temple. Beach view looks good. No near by shops available. But staffs are very helpful all time. We can give 5 star for Privacy. Good resort for both family and friends

Very near to bus stand, Bay watch theme park and sunset point...
Facilities are average. Parking is available but ground floor rooms does not get proper privacy for the family especially the window curtains are very poor.

Hotel maintainence is very good and couple friendly.

This is the first hotel am giving 5 stars .

Every one who's is coming to kanyakumari should have a try at this hotel

Visitors highly recommend it for its wide range of fashion wear, accessories, stationery, and electronics. It's known for offering good prices on items and is particularly renowned as the best place to purchase mud vessels.

placeMetadata.name: Kanyakumari beach

sources.snippet: Those who visit the Kanyakumari Beach make it is a point to visit the Kanyakumari Temple and a number of festivals are celebrated here throughout the year, like the Vaishakha, Kalabham and the Navratri. The beaches come alive during these times and devotees come from far and wide to offer their prayers to the deity. Legends say that the Goddess Kumari considered a manifestation of the Goddess Parvati, performed strict penance and meditation on the now named Vivekananda Rock to be united with Lord Shiva.
sources.shortName: Beauty Sightseeing, Shopping & Best Time to Explore

placeMetadata.address: Vavaturai Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

reviews.reviewText:
Kanyakumari is a must-visit destination, but timing is key! For a comfortable experience,

plan your visit during the morning or evening when the cool breeze and pleasant weather make sightseeing a delight.

Afternoons can be scorching hot, so it's best to avoid them.

Kanyakumari Beach is one of the best coastal spots with numerous scenic viewpoints, especially for witnessing both sunrise and sunset from different angles. As it's a popular tourist destination, you'll find plenty of small shops catering to visitors, along with a variety of local street food to enjoy.

The presence of the iconic temple at Kanyakumari adds a spiritual charm to your visit, making it even more special. There are also plenty of hotels nearby, many offering beautiful beach views from the rooms.

I’m a frequent traveller and I visit Kanyakumari once every two weeks. The view is mesmerising however there is no proper maintenance. The pictures shared shows the condition of the view points. It’s evident that there is no proper maintenance. The Kanyakumari panchayat have increased the entrance ticket charge from 50/- to 100/- and also they are charging additional parking fees. Inspite of collecting these amounts, The Authorities do not provide adequate facilities for tourists. The street sellers are taking advantage and charging more than the required amount for supplies. These suggestions are made so that some improvements will be provided by the Authorities. Whatsoever Kanyakumari is one of the best beaches in Soya India❤️
One of the busiest tourist place in tamilnadu. Nice experience

Sunrise looking so beautiful  and vivekanand rock memorial it's have a huge crowd there are two facility of visit one is special  entry ticket price 300 rupees each and normal entry 75 rupees each but normal line take a long time more then 3 hour so if you have not enough time then try special entry

It's wonderful moment super place...
Sunrise and sunset was amazing

Kaniyakumari is the best place to visit and see the early morning sunset view

The beach is best but the parking lots are not available much space

Not maintained the proper cleaning on the roads and beach fully human and animal wastes surrounded by the beach
Kanyakumari beach is very beautiful and this the best spot to visit in Tamil Nadu

placeMetadata.name: ANNAI RESORTS & SPA

sources.snippet: Annai Resort and Spa can be considered as one of the best beach resorts in Kanyakumari. The resort offers much more than just comfortable accommodation. You will get to find a coffee shop and a multi cuisine restaurant that offers delicious Indian and International dishes to delight your taste buds.
sources.shortName: 10 Kanyakumari Beach Resorts, Book & Get Upto 50% Off

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Nestled in the charming town of Nagercoil, Annai Resorts & Spa offers a delightful escape just a stone's throw away from iconic attractions like Bhagavathy Amman Temple and Gandhi Mandapam. With Kanyakumari Beach and Kumari Amman Temple also nearby, this spa hotel is perfect for those looking to explore the area.
placeMetadata.address: Kovalam Rd, opp. to bus stand, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

reviews.reviewText:
I had a fantastic experience during my stay at this hotel. From the moment I arrived, the staff were warm, welcoming and incredibly helpful.

The check-in process was smooth and quick, and my room was spotless and comfortable.

The location is convenient, with easy access to local attractions. The on-site amenities were top-notch, I especially enjoyed all the things.

This hotel to anyone looking for a pleasant and hassle-free experience.

Overall, it was a great experience!!

The property is just amazing, so beautifully designed, we just loved it. The swimming pool, the kids play area are perfectly placed in the entire property. We stayed for 2 nights in the Premier Villa and celebrated our daughter birthday. We had a great stay. The reception staff needs to be little polite though, while checking out the room, they were really rude and didn’t speak well. Reason we were 30mins late as our daughter (5yo) took more time in getting ready. I would recommend the property if you want to have a luxury experience.

Booked leisure stay with family in 2 Executive premium rooms with breakfast.
Amazing place that is very close to most site seeing places at Kanyakumari.
Breakfast was yummy and had lots of variety.
Staff are friendly.
In-room service was also very nice for my mother.
Cleaning staff were courteous.
We had a good time

VERY DISSOPOINTED EXPERIENCE
We visited this restaurant with high expectations, but unfortunately, the service fell far below acceptable standards. After being seated, we were left unattended for over 20 minutes — no greeting, no menus, no water, and no acknowledgment from any staff member.

Despite making eye contact with a few team members, no one approached our table. Eventually, we decided to leave without being served. While we understand that restaurants can get busy, completely ignoring guests is simply not acceptable.

We hope management takes this feedback seriously and works on improving basic customer service and attentiveness

It was an amazing experience. The battery buggy service to the room and restaurant. The blue wave 🌊, infinity pool drinks and the lovey atmosphere. Special thanks to the desk and to the room service was immediate and on spot. Every issue was taken into consideration. Thank you the amazing stay. Would love come back again.

We have recently stayed at this property. It was absolutely amazing! The view from resort towards the beach was stunning, with crystal-clear blue waters. The resort's amenities were top-notch, including excellent dining options, breakfast was amazing with spectacular South Indian cuisine and friendly staffs. The rooms were comfortable. Disappointed realizing that the sunset view is too far from the resort’s location were simply spectacular. A perfect destination for relaxation and fun!"

Great location, particularly the rooms that are sea facing. Walking distance from all important landmarks.

Good hospitality,  humble and polite staff.

Overall we enjoyed our stay here .

Amazing stay at Annai Resort, Kanyakumari! Perfect location near all attractions, great views, and delicious food at the Coral Reef restaurant. Highly recommend, even if you plan to explore Kovalam. Wonderful staff and overall a great experience!

reviews.reviewText: Best travels in Kanyakumari.  New Asian Tours and Travels was very specific and very genuine in clearing all my doubts. Good experience with  New Asian Tours and Travels customer care service. Quick and quality service.

Suggest don’t choose this travels. Not responsible at all. Driver smokes continuously and don’t care about kids n passengers.

Before making payment, they say AC vehicle and finally you will get some old vehicle and push back also don’t work and vehicle leaks if it rains. and they don’t stop for food till passengers starve due to their known hotels for commission.

They start very late not as promised, so you can’t cover all places in that package. And if you complain they won’t pick the call after that.

I have contacted New Asian tours and travels for Kodaikanal trip with my family. They have provided good vehicle for our trip. The driver (Viji sir)was very understanding and supportive. He guided was where ever we wanted to go and was very good. We reached on time to the places and reached back safely on ahead of time .
Overall experience with the driver and tours and travels was fantastic.

This is my first time experience with New Asian Tours and Travels.  I wanted to book a cab, so I decided to find the best by choosing the agency who has more reviews and they're the one.

It was a nice experience and the driver was very polite, and he suggested excellent restaurants.

Overall, it was a good experience for me and if you're looking for cabs in Kanyakumari pls go for them.

I am very satisfied.  Traveller  rental service was good. They provide full commitment to our journey and give every detail about this trip. The driver was very professional and reached our place with no delay and family members enjoyed the trip with hotels and travel. Overall decent and responsive from new Asian Tours and travels.

Feb. 2022 - I booked a car for three days from Kanyakumari to Kodaikanal. Initially, I was worried considering the Govt situation and traveling with family, however New Asian Tours and Travels is very reliable and trustworthy because they offer me a good vehicle at an affordable price and a talented professional driver who can speak English. Driving ability. We had a very comfortable and memorable trip.
The driver's name is Thanga Raj
I also booked a day tour car to Mahabalipuram and again I was lucky to have another good driver with a good car.
5 ***** rating for new Asian tours and excursions.
God bless them all

My Name Bibisha
I rented a taxi for 4.5 days from New Asian Tours and Travels. The car arrived just in time. Clean and elegant car with excellent conditions. The driver was very nice for the first 4 days and took us without any problems. When we returned on the last day we were asked about 10km to go shopping in Kanyakumari (there is still a lot of km left to meet the minimum requirement) he first thought to take us to his favorite shop. He refused to go to his shop and was very reluctant to take us there. He started to say that I had taken the alternative booking (before our booking time). She persuaded him and took him to the shop he wanted. He later apologized for his behavior. 95% of the time, the driver was very good and if we ignore his last mistake / accept his apology, he has 100% recommendation. I recommend everyone to go with New AsianTours and Travels.
I will definitely use them regularly

Very Good Service. Neat and clean vehicles. Drivers are very much friendly and their behaviour is very good especially Rishap Ji and Shravan Ji.  Punctual.
Overall very good experience. The driver bhaiya gave a vivid knowledge about the historical tourist places.

placeMetadata.name: Chothavilai Beach
placeMetadata.description: Beach retreat offering shallow swimming waters, picnic spots & an observation tower.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chothavilai Beach, also known as Sothavilai Beach, is a top destination in Kanyakumari, located about 10 km from the city. With its 4km stretch of sandy shoreline, it's one of the longest beaches in Tamil Nadu. The beach offers shallow swimming waters and high sand dunes, making it a picturesque spot for beach lovers.
placeMetadata.address: Tamil Nadu, India

reviews.reviewText:
The beach is a wonderful destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. The sound of waves crashing against the shore creates a calming atmosphere, while the sun shining down provides warmth and brightness to your day.

Sunsets at the beach are particularly stunning, with vibrant colors painting the sky as the sun dips below the horizon.

Overall, whether you're seeking peace and quiet or fun-filled activities, the beach is an ideal spot for everyone to enjoy.

And enjoy the aerial view of this beach

A tranquil beach, not bustling with tourists, but frequented by locals. So beach is not deserted, and there are some vendors for tea and coconut water, but remain clean and less crowded. A row of palm tree along the beach, with a few shade huts, provide good protection from sun, making this a perfect place to watch sunset

Place has ample parking for around 10 cars, but road is also empty, so more cars can be parked on road

A very calm and beautiful beach with good sandy shore. Warning sign shows that you should not bath here because it is steep. But you can stand at the shore and feel the cool waves rub your feet. You can play with sand. There are a couple of shops for refreshments. If you want to reach by bus you can board Pallam bus (bus no.36A) or Ambalapathy bus from Anna Bus Stand, Nagercoil (Nagercoil Town Bus Stand) and get down at Osaravilai which is around 10kms from Anna Bus Stand. From osaravilai you can walk down to the beach which is less than 1km from osaravilai.

I've visited Chothavilai Beach multiple times, and each experience has been absolutely wonderful. This beach consistently impresses with its pristine white sand and crystal-clear turquoise waters, creating a postcard-perfect setting. It's my go-to spot for a relaxing and enjoyable day by the sea.

My family and I love spending long hours here, wandering along the shoreline, collecting seashells, and playing catch or Frisbee on some days. We particularly enjoy the tranquil atmosphere away from the main beach, which tends to get crowded in the evenings.

The beach offers ample space for outdoor activities, making it perfect for a day out with loved ones. Whether you're seeking serenity or some fun in the sun, this beach has it all. Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind and connect with nature.
To get the best of this beach, please visit on weekdays in the evening just before the sunset.

Serene beach , less crowded compared to other beaches in Kanyakumari district. The way towards the beach looks a little isolated. But thesea is not safe to play on the sea. The waves are very unpredictable and the sea in this area has an undercurrent which is fatal. So be cautious and stay away from the waves. Enjoy the breeze the water and sunrise sunset safely away from the sea.
Local govt needs to keep more waste collection boxes so that people can drop it there or advise the sellers to bring there own waste boxes to collect and dispose it safely.
One among the many beaches that is available in Kanyakumari district.Enjoy from distance and it's worth it.
Neat and calm beach... no proper rest room available nearby... need more maintenance/safety aspects... good beach to have some time with near ones and have a beach walk...

Always my most favorite beach in Kanyakumari district. It's not hep. It doesn't have too much benches to sit on but who needs all that when you have a good sandy beach! The approach to the waters isn't pristine but it's not garbage either - just driftwood and things washed up from the ocean. You can catch some great sunsets from this beach. It's a good place to also wet your feet. My little son loves this "beachy" so much!

placeMetadata.name: Sanguthurai Beach

sources.snippet: For those wishing for some quiet ‘me-time’, Sanguthurai Beach is the best option in Kanyakumari. Here you can enjoy swimming and watch the waves in loop!. The beach is only nine kilometers from Nagercoil and is the best spot to take your camera out and click some gorgeous pictures.
sources.shortName: Kanyakumari: An incredible beach town in Tamil Nadu

sources.snippet: Sanguthurai Beach is one of Kanyakumari's neatest beaches and is a must-see if you enjoy sunrise and sunset. The white sands of this seaside are particularly eye-catching. This beach appears isolated because it is mostly unspoilt, and you can enjoy your excursion here with family or friends.
sources.shortName: 18 Beautiful Beaches in Tamil Nadu That You Should Visit

placeMetadata.description: A large, white conch sculpture dating from the King Chola–era is found on this long sandy beach.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Sanguthurai Beach, located in the southernmost part of India, is a serene and pristine beach with long stretches of white sand. It features a large, ancient conch sculpture from the King Chola-era and offers a tranquil atmosphere for visitors to enjoy sunrise and sunset. The beach is relatively unspoiled and isolated, making it an ideal destination for those seeking peace and quiet.
placeMetadata.address: Tamil Nadu, India

reviews.reviewText: It’s been taken 2nd place among one of the famous beach in Kanyakumari district. It is a great place to enjoy sun set and to take selfie’s, photoshoot (wedding, baby shoot). Nice place to hangout with friends & family on the beach bump. Has various restaurants to have scrumptious foods & snacks.

Sanguthurai Beach is serene, clean, and peaceful, perfect for quiet walks, stunning sunsets, and escaping the tourist crowds.
You can also refresh your mind, when you are there but it is not that much safe for solo female travellers.

A Hidden Gem of Tranquility and Beauty

Sangudhurai Beach is, without a doubt, one of the most enchanting coastal treasures I've had the pleasure of visiting. From the moment you arrive, you're greeted by an atmosphere of serene beauty that instantly melts away any stress.
What truly sets Sangudhurai apart is its pristine and untouched nature. Unlike many overcrowded beaches, Sangudhurai offers ample space to relax, stroll, and simply soak in the breathtaking surroundings. The sand is soft and golden, perfect for leisurely walks, and the clear turquoise waters are incredibly inviting for a refreshing dip.
The natural beauty here is simply stunning. The gentle waves lapping against the shore create a soothing soundtrack, and the picturesque views of the coastline are mesmerizing, especially during sunrise or sunset – a photographer's dream! It's a place where you can genuinely connect with nature and find a sense of peace.
While it retains its natural charm, there are just enough amenities (like small local vendors for refreshments) to make your visit comfortable without disrupting the tranquility. The locals are also incredibly friendly and welcoming, adding to the overall positive experience.
Whether you're looking for a peaceful escape, a romantic stroll, or a family outing, Sangudhurai Beach delivers beyond expectations. It's a true hidden gem that deserves all five stars and more. I cannot recommend it highly enough – do yourself a favor and experience the magic of Sangudhurai!
Very beautiful and secluded beach. Usually less crowded but has very high tides so not recommended to go for swimming
Clean and beautiful beach to spend the evening. Less crowded with a good coffee place.
Nice Clean Beach Not Too Crowded,Bus Transport Is Available.

Beautiful beach. Lovely calm place to spend an evening with family or alone. There is a restaurant where you can have some food or tea or some snacks there. Will not recommend swimming in the sea water but can really enjoy in the shore and in water avoid going deep inside. This is a place i used to visit from my child hood times and i normally go there alone sit peacefully and listen to ilayaraja music that’s a meditation.
Now the beach has been crowded max in all days and outlets are there for snacks fish fry tea coffee etc

placeMetadata.name: Thengapattanam Beach
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Thengapattanam Beach, situated in Kanyakumari district, is a serene and unspoiled gem that offers a perfect setting for a peaceful retreat. The beach boasts lush coconut groves, tranquil surroundings, and a clean shoreline with gentle waves. It's an ideal spot for nature enthusiasts and photographers seeking picturesque views. Visitors can also witness the traditional coastal lifestyle as local fishermen operate in the area.
placeMetadata.address: Thengapattanam, Tamil Nadu, India

reviews.reviewText: This beach offers a unique blend of scenic beauty and vibrant local culture with its bustling fish market. Fresh catches, lively vendors, and ocean views make it a lively spot for seafood lovers and explorers.
Beaches are not kept clean. Not tourist friendly, though the sea view is quite nice.

Beautiful and peaceful beach – perfect for families!
A wonderful spot to relax with family. It’s clean, less crowded, and offers a calm atmosphere compared to other busy beaches. The sunset view is absolutely stunning – a must-see if you're visiting in the evening!

Swimming or playing in the sea is not allowed due to the steep slope and strong currents, but you can still enjoy a peaceful time walking along the shore, taking photos, and enjoying the cool breeze. There are also coconut trees and scenic spots around that make it ideal for a picnic or short visit.

Highly recommended for a quiet family outing or sunset experience!
Best for relax at evening. Good location for watching fishing boats roaming around. Beach is beautiful,  but Around locations are not clean & neat

Nice place to enjoy pleasant evening with family and friends.Fishing harbor  is also there.

Small yet magnificent beach in tamilnadu. You will get a very good view and enjoy the sunset. It's not usually crowded .

Nice clean beach 🏝 Don’t think you can get into the water as the sea here is rough. There’s a pier which offers good view. There is a fish landing port nearby. It can hot during the day so plan your visit accordingly.

Nowadays at evening and weekend day getting little crowded.

good food shops/ hotels not available nearby.

Proper parking not available, take care of your vehicles from thieves.

Have to improve more snacks and evenings shops their quality.

Loved it..

Thengapattanam beach is very famous for fresh fishes. You will get good quality of fishes for very reasonable prices and it is a bit far from kanyakumari, nearly 55-60 km on the west coast near painkulam village. Thengapattinanam beach is having fine beach filled with coconut groves.
Beach is very peaceful and no rush of tourists since it's not become a well known tourist place. A fine picnic spot and beach. You can see the river merging with the sea here.
Good place to spend your evening with your family... Still needs proper maintenance...

A nice place to have some break from busy city life. Nice and clean beach , main thing is this beach is not crowded. This coastal lineup will be beautiful to watch...!!
SUNSET is the main thing to watch here. The colors of the sunset will be a bliss to watch along with birds flying all around will be a treat to watch. Nice and calm place to have some fun time with friends and family. People who likes loneliness will love this place because this place isnt that crowded and this place will surely give you peace of mind.

placeMetadata.name: Vivekananda Rock Memorial

sources.snippet: The Vivekananda Rock Memorial has been constructed to commemorate Swami Vivekananda, an Indian scholar and philosopher’s visit in 1892 during which he meditated there. He was the proponent of Hindu revivalism and founded the Ramkrishna Mission. The memorial comprises of two parts—the Vivekananda Mandapam and the Shripada Mandapam.

sources.snippet: Revered Indian poet and Hindu philosopher Swami Vivekananda visited Kanyakumari in 1892, towards the end of an extensive trip across India as a wandering monk. His transformation into an influential leader and reformer is attributed to the three days he spent meditating on a large offshore rock, where Goddess Kanya Kumari is said to have carried out part of her penance by standing on one foot. According to ancient Hindu texts, the Puranas, the rock was blessed by the touch of her foot.

reviews.reviewText: Good tourist spot. Price was reasonable. Week days were not crowded. Boat service was good but the life jacket could have maintained properly. The glass bridge was mesmerizing.

Vivekananda Rock Memorial – Beautiful, But Be Prepared

The Vivekananda Rock Memorial is undoubtedly a serene and inspiring place, rich in history and spiritual significance. The view from the rock, surrounded by the endless sea and with the mainland in the distance, is truly breathtaking. It’s a powerful spot where you can reflect and feel deeply connected to nature and Swami Vivekananda’s legacy.

However, the experience getting there was less than ideal. Despite purchasing the ₹300 ferry ticket, we still had to stand in a long, exhausting queue under the scorching sun, with minimal shade or crowd management. It was quite frustrating, especially considering the premium ticket.

Additionally, there’s a separate entrance fee for the temple once you reach the rock, which felt a bit excessive after already paying for the ferry ride. The heat and waiting time took away from the peacefulness we were hoping for.

Tips:

Carry a hat, sunglasses, and water — the sun can be relentless.
Try to visit early in the morning to avoid both the heat and long queues.
Be mentally prepared for the wait, even with a higher-priced ticket.
It’s a must-see spot for its spiritual and scenic value, but a bit of planning (and patience) is necessary to truly enjoy it.

The very sight of Vivekananda Rock from a distance fills you with a deep sense of peace and awe. Once you arrive, be prepared for a wait — even on weekdays, the queue can take around 45 minutes. You can choose between ₹100 or ₹300 tickets depending on your preference, but whichever you choose, the journey is well worth it.

Once you’re there, the calm of the rock, the spiritual energy of the place, the stunning architecture of the memorial, and the majestic Tiruvalluvar statue leave a lasting impression. The glass bridge adds a unique touch to the experience.

Note: There are no food stalls on the premises, so plan your visit after a hearty breakfast or lunch. Free drinking water is available, and there’s a small shop where you can buy books and souvenirs to take a part of the experience home.

A must-visit for those seeking serenity, inspiration, and a connection with India’s spiritual legacy.

Vivekananda Rock memorial is a neatly maintained spot to visit. We need to take the ferry to visit. The ferry service will start around 8 AM in the morning and there will be a long fast moving queue for a 100 rs ticket and for a 300 rs ticket the queue will be very less. But the long queue itself will move faster. In a single trip they'll take around 80+ people i guess. So the queue will move fast. 300 rs ticket ppl will have the first priority to board on the ferry but while returning the 300 rs ticket won't work. All 100 and 300 will have to wait in the same queue to board the ferry to return to the mainland.

reviews.reviewText:
I recently visited the Thiruvalluvar Statue in Kanyakumari, and it was an unforgettable experience. The statue is located on a small island surrounded by the sea, and now there’s a newly built glass sea bridge that connects the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and the Thiruvalluvar Statue. Walking on this bridge was one of the highlights of my trip. You can see the ocean below your feet, and it gives you a thrilling and beautiful view of the surroundings.

The whole area is very clean and well-maintained. The strong sea breeze made the environment feel fresh and relaxing. It was really peaceful to stand near the statue with the wind blowing and enjoy the sound of the waves all around. The scenery is stunning, especially the view of the three oceans — the Bay of Bengal, Arabian Sea, and Indian Ocean — meeting at this point.

The Thiruvalluvar Statue itself is grand and inspiring, honoring one of Tamil Nadu’s greatest poets and philosophers. The peaceful surroundings, combined with the majestic statue and the exciting walk on the sea bridge, created a perfect mix of nature, culture, and adventure.

If you're planning a visit to Kanyakumari, I highly recommend coming early in the morning or near sunset to fully enjoy the view, wind, and light. The sea bridge adds a new dimension to the experience — it's safe, exciting, and offers fantastic photo opportunities.

Great place, need to take government operated boats for the to and fro journey from kanykumari to the statue. It's around 80 Rs to take the boat ride. By giving 300Rs fast moving line can be utilised. Nice scenic place. Try avoiding peak noon time. There is glass bridge connecting between the statue and the meditation centre which is also an attraction.

Kanyakumari is a truly mesmerizing place where nature, history, and spirituality blend beautifully. Watching the sunrise and sunset over the ocean from the same spot is a unique and unforgettable experience. The Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar Statue are both iconic landmarks worth visiting — peaceful, inspiring, and scenic.

The confluence of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean is stunning to witness. The town is clean, the locals are warm and welcoming, and there's a calm spiritual vibe everywhere. Street food is great too, especially the fresh coconut water and local snacks.

Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind, explore Indian culture, or just enjoy coastal beauty. I'd definitely love to return!

Visited the iconic Thiruvalluvar Statue today on 15th July 25 and it was an inspiring experience! Standing tall at 133 feet, this majestic statue honors the legendary Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar, who gifted us the timeless Thirukkural.
The view of the endless ocean all around adds to the peaceful yet powerful atmosphere. It's not just a monument—it's a symbol of ancient wisdom, Tamil pride, and universal values.

Visiting the Thiruvalluvar statue was a really memorable experience. Standing tall against the backdrop of the ocean, the statue looks so majestic and inspiring—it almost feels like it’s watching over the waves with wisdom. The boat ride to reach the statue added to the excitement, and once there, I was amazed by the sheer size and detailed craftsmanship. Being up close made me appreciate not just the beauty but also the cultural importance behind it. The only small drawback was the crowd and a bit of waiting time, but once you’re there, it’s worth it. It’s a place that makes you pause, reflect, and feel proud of such heritage. 🌊🙏

Winds are nice. But overall it's a scam place. There is too much crowd. The queue to go back to ferry ride is too big. It's better to not go there. There is nothing tonsee there. Only the glass bridge can be a okok thing to see. But the glass is tinted and u can't see much.

I have visited Kanyakumari on 7th July for the first time. It is a mesmerising destination of Tamil Nadu.  A 133 foot tall Thiruvalluvar statue worth to watch. Separate building for Vivekanandha rock memorial Hall. Here you can sit and do meditation. Glass bridge is to reach Thiruvalluvar statue is the one of the amazing experience  we can ever had. Very thrilling experience. You can take videos when you are walking on the glass bridge. It’s looks like we are walking on the water. If you reach close to Thiruvalluvar statue it’s difficult to take photo near the statue because of the height of the statue photo won’t cover the full statue. But entrance itself you can see the front view of the Thiruvalllivar statue.

Eknath Ranadeji who founded the  Vivekananda Memorial Hall, Kanyakumari,  suggested that a statue of Thiruvalluvar be erected on a nearby rock and gave the full plan, map and estimate to the then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi .
A boat called a 'Pantoon' was purchased from Kochi to transport the stones for the construction of the statue .
On January 1, 2000, the then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi inaugurated the statue.

One can reach here from the Vivekananda Rock through a glass bridge.

Thiruvalluvar is a Tamil poet who composed the Tamil literature called Thirukural.
His statue has been erected on a rock 30 feet above the water level where the three seas meet.

The Swami Vivekananda Memorial Hall has been erected on a rock in the middle of the Kanyakumari sea and the 133-foot-tall Thiruvalluvar statue on another rock nearby.
The Silver Jubilee is being celebrated to mark the completion of 25 years since the installation of the Thiruvalluvar statue.

A glass fibre bridge has been built to connect these two at a cost of Rs. 37 crores.
This was opened to the public on 30 th December 2024.
Thousands of people walk on this glass bridge and enjoy the beauty of the sea before reaching the Thiruvalluvar Statue area.
Tourists  went from the boat house to Vivekananda Rock walked through the glass fiber bridge and visited the Thiruvalluvar statue.

reviews.reviewText:
📣Kanyakumari Amman Temple: 4:30 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM.
Vivekananda Rock Memorial: 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM, with ferry services operating during those hours.
Padmanabhapuram Palace: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM, and again from 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM.
Vattakottai Fort: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM.

Boats to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanyakumari typically operate from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. The ferry ride takes about 30 minutes to reach the memorial.
The visiting timing of Saint Thiruvalluvar Statue is from 8 AM to 4 PM. The charge for ferry services from the shore to the statue are Rs. 20 per person

Pricing in Kanyakumari
Ferry Type	Price Range (INR)
Standard M2M Ferries	500 - 800
Luxury M2M Ferries	1500 - 2500
Roro Ferry	700 - 1200
Ajanta Ferry	600 - 1000

The best time to visit Kanyakumari is between October to February as the temperature during these months usually drops and ranges between 20-30 degree Celsius.

Kanyakumari is open to visitors throughout the day. Specific opening and closing times apply to various attractions, but the general rule is that the main sites are open from early morning until late afternoon/early evening.

The statue is built as per Indian architectural styles, and is hollow inside. However, tourists are allowed to climb only up to the foot of the statue. Along with the Vivekananda Rock Memorial, the statue attracts millions of tourists annually and is one of the must-visit spots in your trip to Tamil Nadu.

Watching the sunrise at Kanyakumari Beach is truly breathtaking – a must-see experience. However, the beach gets extremely crowded on weekends, making it a bit difficult to enjoy peacefully. Unfortunately, the beach was quite unclean and dirty, which took away from the overall experience.

Kanyakumari Beach is a mesmerizing destination where the blue waters meet the land’s edge. With the sea on three sides, it offers breathtaking views, making it a unique coastal experience. The beach is safe for bathing, allowing visitors to enjoy the refreshing waves. Changing rooms are available, ensuring convenience for travelers. As the southernmost tip of India, this location holds special significance and provides a spectacular horizon where the ocean seems endless. A must-visit spot for anyone seeking beauty and tranquility by the shore.

Kanyakumari Beach offers a breathtaking view where the Bay of Bengal, Arabian Sea, and Indian Ocean meet. The sunrise and sunset here are magical, especially from the View Tower and near the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. The beach is rocky, not ideal for swimming, but perfect for peaceful walks, photography, and soaking in the spiritual and scenic atmosphere.

Nice beach.it was raining..it was a long wait to get ticket for the ferry to reach the statue..if you are not patient enough to wait in a queue it's better to go for a 300 Rs ticket it's like direct entrance but the same ferry for evebody..but once you the glass bridge it is so good..
Witnessing the sunrise in Kanyakumari was truly a soul-stirring experience. Finally stepping into the glass bridge was a great experience of thrill and beauty 💙. Everyone should experience this!!!

“Kanyakumari Beach is truly a special place where you can witness the meeting point of the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal, and Indian Ocean. The view is breathtaking, especially during sunrise and sunset when the sky lights up with beautiful colors. The beach area is clean and has a calm atmosphere with plenty of spots to sit and enjoy the sea breeze. From here, you also get a clear view of the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar Statue. A must-visit destination in Kanyakumari for nature lovers, photographers, and anyone who wants to enjoy a peaceful seaside experience.”

The most beautiful destination with high footfall. But infrastructure flop. Cannot find  a clean public comfort station, expanded parking facility, water kiosks, waiting areas etc. Instead can experience severe extortion of tourist by locals. Car owners have to pay at check post and parking area simultaneously for touring along beach side. Parking big problem as we have to bribe for allowing parking in private places and streets. The most popular rock structured shrine kanyakumari devi temple is found kept in a dilapidated state without proper access and affairs inside mismanaged. The vivekananda rock, thiruvalluvar statue, glass bridge, laser shows, tirupati temple, sucheendram temple, kumarakovil temple, onshore mupanthal windmill, thovala flower cultivations etc are some of the places to visit here. Hotels and restaurants found unhygienic without food safety inspections. Renovated ttdc somewhat good for food and stay. Street vendors occupying public spaces in an inconsiderate manner is affecting the beauty and charm and ambience of kanyakumari. Just projecting sun rise and sun set can't do with tourism  alone. Establishing world class activities and amenities is the need of the hour for keeping kanyakumari into a world class travel destination as the new highway is going to pave way for good access.

sources.snippet: So now that we have virtually travelled all the way to Kanyakumari, let’s first take a spiritual tour to the most revered temple of the city, Kanyakumari Devi Temple. This temple that has its foundation dating back to over 3000 years and it is dedicated to Shakti or Devi Kanya Kumari who is worshipped in the form of a girl child performing penance. The shrine is also revered as one of the 51 Shakti Peethas which are the abode of the divinity Shakti and are the places where the body parts of the Goddess fell when Lord Shiva was carrying her corpse.
sources.shortName: Top 18 Places to Visit & Things to Do in Kanyakumari

sources.snippet: This temple is the most revered temple in this town and this destination was also named after the Goddess Kanya Kumari. This temple is one of the 51 shaktipeethas, which means when Lord Shiva was carrying the lifeless body of Goddess Sati, one of her body parts fell here where the temple’s built. Once you lay eyes on the breathtaking idol of Devi Kanyakumari with rosary in one hand and gold jewelry on her nostrils, you’ll be mesmerized.

reviews.reviewText: Amazing temple!! You need to pay anyone anything. Just walk in to have a blessed darshan!!. Men will have to open their shirts. The temple is old, and the idol is amazing. The nose ring, which is the highlight, shines in all glory!! History has it that ships used to steer to coast seeing the shine of the nose ring!! It's really worth visiting. Views from behind temples are also good!

The temple is about 1 to 2 km from the railway station—easy to reach by walk or auto. Don’t miss the beautiful sunrise at Kanyakumari—it’s a must-see!

The deity here is very powerful and divine. For male devotees, shirts or T-shirts are not allowed inside the temple. Only dhoti or pants are allowed, and the upper body must be uncovered.

There are both free and paid darshan options available. For fresh-up, there are many clock rooms and fresh-up rooms nearby. No need to spend much on rooms—basic fresh-up facilities are available for just ₹30.

A peaceful and powerful place to visit with spiritual energy all around.

Kanyakumari, the southernmost tip of India, is a place where land, sea, and sky converge in breathtaking harmony. Renowned for its stunning sunrise views over the Bay of Bengal, it offers a serene spectacle that draws travelers from around the world. The Vivekananda Rock Memorial stands as a tribute to spiritual reflection and national pride, while the ancient Bhagavathi Amman Temple, dedicated to the goddess Kanyakumari, adds a layer of historical and cultural depth to this coastal gem.

Amman Temple is a must-visit for anyone in Kanyakumari. The temple is beautifully maintained and has a serene, spiritual atmosphere. The early morning visit is highly recommended to avoid crowds and to experience the tranquility of the place.
I visited during the early hours, just in time for the Arti   and it was incredibly peaceful. The divine energy of the temple combined with the soft chants and cool morning breeze made for a truly spiritual experience. The temple is dedicated to Goddess Kanyakumari, and the structure is magnificent, reflecting both historical significance and spiritual beauty. The temple complex is clean, and the surroundings are calming.

Good experience in the temple. Visited on a weekday evening at 6 pm (27th June)

reviews.reviewText:
The Gandhi Memorial near Triveni is a significant tourist attraction, holding historical importance as the site where Mahatma Gandhi's ashes were kept before his final rites. The memorial beautifully chronicles Gandhi's journey from Porbandir to his final days, highlighting his pivotal role in India's freedom movement.

This iconic structure proudly showcases India's rich cultural heritage, offering insights into Gandhi's teachings, philosophy, and service to the nation. The 79-foot-high central building symbolizes Gandhi's age at the time of his passing.

A striking feature of the memorial is its architectural design, where the ceiling's opening allows sunlight to illuminate the spot where Gandhi's ashes were kept on his birth anniversary, October 2nd. The rooftop offers breathtaking panoramic views of the surrounding ocean.

Best of all, entry to the memorial is free, making it accessible to all who wish to pay their respects and learn about India's history.

Proudly upholding the rich cultural heritage of India, the Gandhi Memorial offers a clear picture of the teachings, philosophy, ideal and services rendered by Mahatma Gandhi for the country.

The central area of the building has been built in a way that stands 79 feet high, symbolizing the age of Mahatma Gandhi at the time of his demise.

The most striking feature here is the ceiling of the building. It has an opening that has been built in such a way that on every 2nd October, (birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi) rays of Sun falls exactly on the spot where his ashes were kept.

The roof of the memorial gives a beautiful panoramic view of the ocean around.

Entry to the memorial is free..

So, I heard about the amazing Kamaraja, and I really wanted to know more about him, you know?
The Kamarajar Mandapam was built to remember Mr. Kamaraj, who was the chief minister of Tamil Nadu for 13 years. He was famous for being simple and honest.
It's a great place to go, it's kept up really well, and it's super peaceful. It's a good spot for meditating, too. Plus, it's the best place to see where the rivers meet the sea and the beach. They have photos that show his life story, which is really cool. It's all organized nicely, and the surroundings are nice. It's a good place to bring the kids so they can learn about awesome people.
You don't have to pay to get in but the uncle who tells the stories about this will ask some money.

Another monument Kamarajar Manimandapam was raised and dedicated to Late. Sri. Kamarajar, The freedom fighter, Former Chief minister of Tamil Nadu, President of Indian National Congress. He was popularly known as Black Gandhi among the masses and king maker during congress regime.  He is still called by all as “Perunthalaivar”. He played vital roles in the administration of TamilNadu, by introducing education for down trodden and also started the Noon Meal scheme for the students to encourage education. Development activities like Dams and Industries in Tamilnadu took place during his rule. This monument was constructed where his ashes were kept here for public to pay homage before immersion into the sea.

Visting Hours -7 AM To 7 PM .

Kamarajar actively participated in the Indian independence movement, working alongside other prominent leaders to fight for India's freedom from British rule.

Like many other freedom fighters, Kamarajar faced imprisonment for his political activities against the British.

After India gained independence, Kamarajar continued to serve the nation as a politician. He became the Chief Minister of Madras State (now Tamil Nadu) and later served as the President of the Indian National Congress.

He is also known for his influence in Indian politics, particularly his role in elevating Lal Bahadur Shastri and Indira Gandhi to the position of Prime Minister, earning him the title "Kingmaker".

Visited on today morning it is situated near Gandhi Mandapam, offering visitors a chance to explore multiple historical sites in close proximity.  Inside, the photographic exhibits provide a comprehensive overview of Kamaraj's life, his contributions to India's political landscape, and his dedication to public service.

Kanniyakumari, the country's southernmost tip offers a diverse array of attractions, such as beaches, temples, museums, and more. One must-see attraction is the Kamarajar Manimandapam in Kanyakumari, a significant historical site dedicated to Kamarajar, a freedom fighter and former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu.

The picturesque town of Kanyakumari was chosen by the government as the final resting place for Kamaraj's ashes, allowing people to pay their respects before the ashes are submerged in the sea, in consideration of Kingmaker Kamaraj's popularity.

Visiting Time 7Am To 7Pm

We felt a wave of disappointment wash over us. As we approached the mandapam, we became increasingly cautious, especially when we noticed a man lurking nearby, persistently asking for money. This unexpected encounter was frustrating, as we were unaware of his intentions before stepping inside. It felt as though we had been caught in a trap, and ultimately, he managed to take 200 rupees from us. It left us with a bitter experience, wishing we had been informed beforehand about this practice.

During our visit to the Kamarajar Mani Mandapam in Kanyakumari, we were deeply moved by the tribute to Shri K. Kamaraj, a revered freedom fighter and former Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu. Known as the "Black Gandhi" and "Perunthalaivar," Kamaraj was instrumental in introducing the free midday meal scheme in schools in 1962, encouraging education among the underprivileged.

The memorial is situated near the Triveni Sangam, adjacent to the Gandhi Mandapam, offering visitors a chance to explore multiple historical sites in close proximity.  Inside, the photographic exhibits provide a comprehensive overview of Kamaraj's life, his contributions to India's political landscape, and his dedication to public service.

The architecture of the mandapam is notable, blending traditional Dravidian elements with contemporary design, reminiscent of a gopuram found in South Indian temples.  The serene ambiance of the memorial offers a space for reflection on the enduring legacy of a leader who prioritized education and social welfare.

Overall, the Kamarajar Mani Mandapam stands as a significant landmark in Kanyakumari, honoring a leader whose vision and efforts have left a lasting impact on Tamil Nadu and India as a whole.

Kamarajar, as Chief Minister of Madras State (now Tamil Nadu), oversaw the construction of numerous dams during his tenure. While the exact number is not specified, several significant dams were built during his period, including the Parambikulam Dam, Lower Bhavani, Krishnagiri, Mani Muthuar, Cauvery delta, Aarani River, Vaigai Dam, Amravathi, Sathanur, Pullambadi, and Neyaru Dams.

sources.snippet: No place in the whole of Kanyakumari can proffer you a splendid view of its beautiful tourist spots like the Kumari Amman temple, Vivekananda Rock Memorial and Thiruvalluvar statue than the View tower can. Finding its place in the seashore, this view tower is fully equipped with telescope instruments using which one can have a look at not only the sea but the above-mentioned attractions. Within the change of the swirling sky into a large degree canvas of vibrant hues the audience may as well indulge in the tranquil ambiance and capture some beautiful memories through pictures. The nightly event at Sunset View Point attracts a multitude of visitors – both tourists and locals – who come every evening to behold the tranquility and splendor of nature during the waning hours and revel in the twilight hours’ exquisite beauty.

reviews.reviewText: Located about 1 km from the heart of the city, baywatch is a poorly maintained water themed kids park. The entry fee is rupees 600 per adult and 500 per kids taller than 90cms height. It has 3- 4 water pools for kids that are very safe due to their depth but dirty due to poor cleanup. The water consists of tonnes of dirt and lacks attractiveness. Least crowded except when there are kids from nearby schoold visits during excursions. Lot of strees with loads of birdshit waiting for your heads and shoulders if you are sitting in tree shadow. Poor quality costumes can be bought at high quality prices for water activities. A ride in the small toy trai will test the strength of your bones. A wave pool is there mostly works like a garbage pool due to gallons of muck. Overall, an avoidable outing.

Wasted my 1450/- rupees straight. 1200/- for 2 adult ticket. 95/- rupees for tea, coffee and snacks. Tea is not even close to hot water LoL. 100/- bucks auto charge on top of that 50/- rupees for small locker wow.

They don't switch on all  rides till 12.45 pm. If they switch on the water rides also like wave pool, Rain Dance and others that only 5 minutes exact. So don't be a fool by purchasing the tickets here not at all required to visit the place. Half of the dry rides not working or maintenance required.

Water rides switched on for 5 minutes. If you ask them for service they don't even bother to answer after purchasing the ticket. Don't eat inside the restaurant. The bumping car was allowed only for 3 minutes and re entry not allowed wow and 600/- is a ticket price. 9D movie was a flop for which they are charging 120/- bucks for one movie around 4-5 minutes.

Water quality was so bad me and my son got skin rashes. They are not changing and cleaning the water regularly. The best cheat part was after all this they have lunch break for their rides which was 1 pm to 2 pm.

Before entering I have requested them may I see the place first they told straight no. No one should visit this place in there dream also.

Sunrise Point, located parallel to the iconic Vivekananda Rock, is truly a serene and beautiful spot. As the last accessible point of the Indian mainland, it offers a peaceful ambiance and stunning views that make the experience unforgettable.

We visited the place in the evening and were captivated by the calm surroundings and the gentle sound of the waves. The natural beauty of the location creates a perfect moment of reflection and stillness.

However, visitors should tread carefully – the path is made of irregular stone boulders, which can be uneven and tricky to walk on, especially in low light. Comfortable footwear and caution are a must.

We plan to return tomorrow morning to witness the sunrise from this tranquil spot — we’ve heard it’s a magical sight not to be missed.

Will be a bit crowded in early morning. Sun rise without clouds is a great sight from this place. It s must see place if you come to kanyakumari.  The view of Thiruvallur rock and vivekanand statue and the glass bridge from this place is awesome

placeMetadata.name: The Hidden Twin beach

sources.snippet: While there are plethora of beaches that you can find in Kanyakumari the best among them are Kanyakumari beach, Muttom beach and the hidden twin beach. Talking about the famous Kanyakumari beach, well apart from the fact that it gets its name from the Kanyakumari temple and is surrounded by all the top attractions close to the sea, it is also known for the fairs and festivals, local shops and stores that sell anything and everything. Apart from this, the Muttom and the hidden twin beach (Sothavilai and Sanguthurai) are known for offering some of the most relaxing vibes and are visited less in comparison to Kanyakumari beach.

The Hidden Twin Beach in Kanyakumari, India, is a serene and picturesque destination that offers a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. With its pristine golden sands, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and lush greenery, this beach is a perfect paradise for nature lovers and those seeking relaxation ¹.

*Key Highlights:*

- _Unspoiled Natural Beauty_: The beach boasts pristine golden sands and crystal-clear turquoise waters, making it an ideal spot for swimming, sunbathing, and snorkeling ¹.
- _Peaceful Atmosphere_: The Hidden Twin Beach provides a peaceful escape from the crowds, making it perfect for families with children or those seeking a relaxing day by the sea ¹.
- _Thriving Marine Life_: The beach is known for its vibrant underwater world, filled with colorful coral reefs and exotic fish species, making it a paradise for snorkelers and divers ¹.

*Amenities and Activities:*

- _Clean Restroom Facilities_: The beach has well-maintained restroom facilities, making it a convenient spot for visitors ¹.
- _Designated Picnic Areas_: There are several shaded spots with benches, perfect for a picnic with friends or family ¹.
- _Lifeguards_: The presence of lifeguards ensures the safety of visitors, further enhancing the overall experience ¹.

Overall, The Hidden Twin Beach is a must-visit destination for those seeking a relaxing and peaceful beach experience in India.

reviews.reviewText:
In my opinion, this is currently the best value-for-money fine dining option in Kanyakumari. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and it’s not overly crowded—a perfect setting for a relaxed meal. Prices are quite reasonable compared to other similar establishments, and the service was prompt, with food arriving fairly quickly.

I highly recommend trying the chicken cheese balls; they were delightfully meaty and cheesy. The prawn tempura was enjoyable as well. Overall, a great spot for family dining. Definitely worth a visit!

Here’s a 200-word review for Sea View Restaurant:

Visited Sea View Restaurant yesterday with my family for lunch, and we had a lovely experience. The ambiance is relaxed and welcoming, with a nice view that adds to the overall vibe of the place. We ordered a mix of dishes – South Indian vegetarian meal, prawns biryani, mutton curry, and parottas.

The South Indian veg meal was served with a variety of items, all freshly prepared and flavorful. The prawns biryani was aromatic and well-spiced, with tender prawns and perfectly cooked rice. The mutton curry was rich, spicy, and paired really well with the soft, flaky parottas. Every dish had a homely touch, which we really appreciated.

Service was prompt and polite. The staff were courteous and attentive without being intrusive, which made the experience even better. Our food was served hot and without unnecessary delay.

Pricing was quite reasonable for the quality and portion size. It’s clear that the restaurant focuses on giving a good overall experience rather than just fancy presentation.

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here and would definitely recommend Sea View Restaurant for anyone looking for a satisfying family lunch with good food, great service, and a pleasant setting. Will surely visit again.

Nice place. Decent. Clean. Location next sea and Kanyakumari amma temple.
Cheerful staff always ready to help. Rooms are clean and spacious enough. Silent at night. Really enjoyed the stay.

Good experience!

Overall a good restaurant near the Kanyakumari Beach & other tourist attractions.

We had the below dishes:
South Indian Meal - 4/5

Parotta with Kurma - 4/5
