The masala dosa was a complete letdown. It's not about quantity but the quality and taste, both of which were severely lacking. The dosa was incredibly bland, and the coffee was equally disappointing. Cleanliness was a major issue, making the overall experience unpleasant. I would not recommend this place.

We had breakfast here early in the morning, before heading to Vivekanand rock memorial. Place has ample parking available. Place was packed, but we were seated quickly within 5 minutes.

It took some time to place first order, but food came quickly after that. Food was nothing extra ordinary, but average.

I think they don't really care about their customers. There was no one to take our order. When we asked about the dishes the guy was just running and saying something. They didn't care if we order or not. One of the worst service ever experienced.

Other than that the food was good and the place is neat and had space.

There are other great hotels nearby, which provides much better service and good food. I won't recommended this hotel considering the service.
We had tried their fried rice, veg meals and gobi manchurian fry. Food was ok. Good dining options and have ample parking space. Cleanliness was average.

We had a very disappointing experience at Hotel Triveni. The food quality is poor and hygiene is clearly lacking. I ordered two parotas which cost Rs. 75, served with a tiny bowl of curry that was watery and tasteless. Definitely not worth the price.

What’s worse is the pricing for beverages—tea is charged between Rs. 30 to 60, but there’s absolutely no justification for it. It’s not about the quantity, but the quality and taste, which are both missing.

Overall, I would not recommend Hotel Triveni, especially considering their high charges for such substandard food and service.

We would love to visit again if we are in Kanyakumari next.

Have a really good view. Clean and good ambiance.The food served are excellent and not over priced for the service and view you get. We have visited a couple of other hotels in kanyakumari during out two day stayed and we liked here the most.

NB: if you have difficulty finding this place it's on 7th floor of hot sea shore.
The view is amazing, located by the ocean. The service is also very good, and it feels so peaceful there. Everything was nice and reasonably priced. It was pleasant to be there

placeMetadata.name: The Curry

sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Located in Kanyakumari, The Curry is a renowned multi-cuisine restaurant offering a diverse culinary experience. It features an extensive menu with dishes from China, Japan, Mexico, Thailand, South India, and North India. Additionally, it caters to specific dietary preferences such as Jain, Bengali, Continental, and Gujarati cuisine. This vegetarian-friendly establishment also boasts a delectable seafood selection including Salmon Croquettes and Shrimp taco salad.
placeMetadata.address: 2/17B, E Car St, near Seashore, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

reviews.reviewText:
The Curry Restaurant is a delightful place to dine in Kanyakumari, offering a vibrant menu with a wide range of flavorful dishes to choose from. Whether you’re in the mood for classic South Indian meals, rich North Indian curries, or fresh seafood, there’s something here for every palate. The ambiance is cozy yet lively, making it a great spot for both families and solo travelers.

What truly sets this place apart is the excellent staff. They are warm, attentive, and quick to accommodate requests, ensuring a pleasant dining experience. The food is well-prepared, portions are generous, and the service is consistently prompt. A must-visit for anyone looking for good food and a welcoming vibe in Kanyakumari.

The place is jam packed for dinner and crazy waiting line. But I think it's the go to place for safe choices here.

Ordered Japan chicken, chicken omicron, chicken nanjil curry and chicken lollipop. Omicron was super sweet and saucy but unique taste. Japan chicken was sweet as well but in white gravy. The chicken curry was below average and lollipop was really good. They don't have any particular order while serving, they randomly bring dishes.

Disappointed as wanted to try Prawns and fish but they serve that on selective days I guess.

Courteous staff and fast service.

I visited this restaurant on a weekday in January. It’s a decent non-vegetarian spot with a good ambiance near Sanathi Street and the seashore. However, the food is very spicy and oily. Some dishes seemed frozen and reheated before serving. Additionally, the staff was not welcoming.

Food tastes good and highly recommended for family.Staff need training, better you check with them multiple times for food and Bill. Getting bill itself was a task for us and we waited nearly 30 min. All other factors are good in this restaurant.

"Delicious food, generous portions, and great value for money. I’ll definitely be coming back again!"
The food was great and the staff were also nice. The ambience were really good
Had a yummy and truly satisfying dinner at The Curry Restaurant Kanyakumari

The only decent restaurant i have found in entire KANYAKUMARI. Price is resonable. Food quantity is great. Food tastes good. Staffs are gentle & polite . One must visit here with their family . Worth it.
Excellent service and all the staff are very nice and always have a smile. I ordered tandoori chicken and the flavors were great. Well balanced and good spice. The chocolate milkshake was also good.

Biriyani is simply the worst, dont order biriyani here , fried rice and dragon chicken is good..price didn't do justice for the quality of the food..over all very average restaurant and go for it only when u dont have any other option around...

placeMetadata.name: Sea Shore Food Court

sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

placeMetadata.address: Beach Rd, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

reviews.reviewText:
Night Life Ambiance with Food!🌌🌮🍔
I recently visited Seashore Food Court of Kanyakumari and had a delightful experience. The area offers a diverse range of food options including Chaatwala, Beach Cafe, Coffee Shop, and Seafood.
My favorite spot was the Coffee Shop where I enjoyed a cup of their premium filter coffee – it was truly exceptional.
The ambiance of the food court is fantastic, with well-placed lights creating a welcoming and vibrant atmosphere.
Walking around and exploring the different counters was a pleasure, especially with the cool sea breeze adding to the charm. Seashore Food Court is a great place to relax and enjoy a variety of delicious food in a beautiful setting in the evening.

lovely place with a great atmosphere! The sea view and the interior design seem to make it a pleasant spot to visit. With new shops opening soon, it will likely become even more vibrant. The fact that some shops are already running smoothly is a good sign. The children's play area adds a family-friendly touch, making it a perfect place for both family and friends to enjoy together

It  has good Sea view, good interior specially in the evening. A good place to go with family and friends

Food i have not tried.

Toilet facility available but at a cost of Rs.20/- it's too much, atleast it should be free of cost.

Tried -

Ginger tea -Rs.40-rating-5/5 -
Normal tea -Rs. 35
Masala tea- Rs.40
a little High in pricing but worth it as compared to location and seating arrangement.

Chat section -pani Puri, dahi Puri etc., pricing is sky rocket. Menu is uploaded.

Filter coffee not available only Bru coffee.

Need improvement in regard of Pricing, service and quality.

Pros:
1) Sea view dining and the ambience gives you good vibes definitely.

2) Food quality is worthy.

3) Play zone for kids gives your family some more quality time here.

4) Baby feeding rooms are available here, so young parents can also take a trip here.

5) Sufficient washrooms available

Cons:

1) Food quantity is little lesser than my normal diet(but sufficient for other, I guess).

2) Washrooms stinks a little.

Best time to visit: Evening or for dinner
(My opinion)

Good place and nice idea to start something like this very near to the sea, all food option are available. Very neatly maintained. Average Food bit expensive compared to the fact that one Tea is RS.10 outside and here its RS.35 , now you can compare the cost of other food items.Washroom are neatly maintained and there is space for kids play area as well. Recommended ..

Located in a nice place open food court with lots of space,stalls are neat. Staffs are helpful.Bathroom needs cleaning that's why giving four stars. Food rates are bit higher compared to other places and quantity is less.

This area is located in Kumari where the three seas meet to further enhance its beauty.  Tourists from all walks of life especially children, teenagers and the elderly come to enjoy this area.  Very beautifully designed with colored lights.  It is common for visitors to this place to take pictures of themselves without fail.  A foreign experience for photography lovers is available at this place.  The food served at this place is very tasty.  From many places and from many states especially foreigners come to this place to take pictures and eat the food here.  A must visit place for visitors to Kanyakumari
It was closed when i visited both in the morning and evening. I don't know why.

placeMetadata.name: Baywatch restaurant

sources.snippet: For dinner, enjoy a romantic meal at The Baywatch Restaurant, where you can savor delicious dishes while watching the sunset.
sources.shortName: 7 Days Romantic Kanyakumari Getaway: Itinerary 2025

placeMetadata.address: 3GJM+VJF, NH 44, Kanniyakumari, Tamil Nadu 629702, India

reviews.reviewText: Not good for family

placeMetadata.name: Chothavilai Beach
placeMetadata.description: Beach retreat offering shallow swimming waters, picnic spots & an observation tower.
placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Chothavilai Beach, also known as Sothavilai Beach, is a top destination in Kanyakumari, located about 10 km from the city. With its 4km stretch of sandy shoreline, it's one of the longest beaches in Tamil Nadu. The beach offers shallow swimming waters and high sand dunes, making it a picturesque spot for beach lovers.
placeMetadata.address: Tamil Nadu, India

reviews.reviewText:
The beach is a wonderful destination that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and adventure. The sound of waves crashing against the shore creates a calming atmosphere, while the sun shining down provides warmth and brightness to your day.

Sunsets at the beach are particularly stunning, with vibrant colors painting the sky as the sun dips below the horizon.

Overall, whether you're seeking peace and quiet or fun-filled activities, the beach is an ideal spot for everyone to enjoy.

And enjoy the aerial view of this beach

A tranquil beach, not bustling with tourists, but frequented by locals. So beach is not deserted, and there are some vendors for tea and coconut water, but remain clean and less crowded. A row of palm tree along the beach, with a few shade huts, provide good protection from sun, making this a perfect place to watch sunset

Place has ample parking for around 10 cars, but road is also empty, so more cars can be parked on road

A very calm and beautiful beach with good sandy shore. Warning sign shows that you should not bath here because it is steep. But you can stand at the shore and feel the cool waves rub your feet. You can play with sand. There are a couple of shops for refreshments. If you want to reach by bus you can board Pallam bus (bus no.36A) or Ambalapathy bus from Anna Bus Stand, Nagercoil (Nagercoil Town Bus Stand) and get down at Osaravilai which is around 10kms from Anna Bus Stand. From osaravilai you can walk down to the beach which is less than 1km from osaravilai.

I've visited Chothavilai Beach multiple times, and each experience has been absolutely wonderful. This beach consistently impresses with its pristine white sand and crystal-clear turquoise waters, creating a postcard-perfect setting. It's my go-to spot for a relaxing and enjoyable day by the sea.

My family and I love spending long hours here, wandering along the shoreline, collecting seashells, and playing catch or Frisbee on some days. We particularly enjoy the tranquil atmosphere away from the main beach, which tends to get crowded in the evenings.

The beach offers ample space for outdoor activities, making it perfect for a day out with loved ones. Whether you're seeking serenity or some fun in the sun, this beach has it all. Highly recommended for anyone looking to unwind and connect with nature.
To get the best of this beach, please visit on weekdays in the evening just before the sunset.

Serene beach , less crowded compared to other beaches in Kanyakumari district. The way towards the beach looks a little isolated. But thesea is not safe to play on the sea. The waves are very unpredictable and the sea in this area has an undercurrent which is fatal. So be cautious and stay away from the waves. Enjoy the breeze the water and sunrise sunset safely away from the sea.
Local govt needs to keep more waste collection boxes so that people can drop it there or advise the sellers to bring there own waste boxes to collect and dispose it safely.
One among the many beaches that is available in Kanyakumari district.Enjoy from distance and it's worth it.
Neat and calm beach... no proper rest room available nearby... need more maintenance/safety aspects... good beach to have some time with near ones and have a beach walk...

Always my most favorite beach in Kanyakumari district. It's not hep. It doesn't have too much benches to sit on but who needs all that when you have a good sandy beach! The approach to the waters isn't pristine but it's not garbage either - just driftwood and things washed up from the ocean. You can catch some great sunsets from this beach. It's a good place to also wet your feet. My little son loves this "beachy" so much!

ops.insert: Sacred monument in honour of a Hindu monk built on a rock half a kilometre out to sea.
Sandy beach at the southern tip of the Indian Peninsula known for sunsets & moonrises over 3 seas.
Monumental, 40m-high statue and pedestal, of eminent Tamil poet and philosopher, on a small island.

place.name: Arulmigu Devi Kanniyakumari Baghavathi Amman Temple

ops.insert: Ornate temple & pilgrimage site, dating back thousands of years, dedicated to Hindu goddess Kumari.

place.name: Shrine of Our Lady of Ransom

ops.insert: Catholic church built in the Gothic Revival architectural style with a pearl-white exterior.
Helical pedestrian ramp perched above the water, with views of the rocky coastline & ocean sunsets.
Family-friendly park with kids' water slides, wave pools & rides like trains & bumper cars.
Traditional, Chinese & European fare served in a polished spot with views of the Laccadive Sea.
Indian, Continental & Chinese fare served in a casual ambiance with expansive sea & beach views.
Popular locale for watching the sunset featuring a rocky shoreline with park benches above.
Beach retreat offering shallow swimming waters, picnic spots & an observation tower.
